intro: Psychotria chaunantha, commonly known as the "Columbian arrow poison," is a species of flowering plant native to Central and South America. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes over 13,000 species of flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its small, elliptical leaves and clusters of white to pale pink flowers. Its most notable botanical feature is the presence of alkaloids, particularly psychotrimine, which has been used traditionally by indigenous peoples for medicinal and ritual purposes. The plant thrives in humid, shaded environments, typically in tropical rainforests.
